steps.title: Landing on the app / Dashboard
details: Site loads quickly; logo visible – confidence starts high.

steps.title: Basic field inputs – Name & Address (Bill From)
details: Typing into text fields immediately reflects in Live Preview – experience feels responsive.

steps.title: Tab default (‘From & To’) styling
details: Expected black background not present; tester cannot confirm active state. First visible UI inconsistency.

steps.title: Adding a custom input (‘Gender = Male’)
details: Field accepts entry but value never appears in Live Preview → user doubts data integrity.

steps.title: Deleting a custom input
details: Removal works and field disappears – control feels reliable here.

steps.title: Navigating to ‘Invoice Details’ via Next button
details: Tab switch and heading render correctly – regains trust.

steps.title: Uploading invoice logo
details: Click on Invoice Details tab fails (element not found) in one run; later run hits 429 error when uploading image. Blocker for brand-critical feature.

steps.title: Selecting / Removing logo
details: Upload already failed; subsequent ‘remove’ scenario cannot proceed. UX for logo management remains unverified.

steps.title: Issue Date picker
details: Date can be chosen and field shows value, but Live Preview never updates → user confused whether date saved.

steps.title: Choosing invoice template
details: Both templates visible, but selecting Template 2 doesn’t show ‘selected’ state; preview doesn’t flip layout. Core personalization feels broken.

steps.title: End-to-end PDF generation
details: Automation hits complexity limit filling long form; indicates flow is lengthy / high-friction for real users too.

emotional_arc: Starts confident (logo, basic inputs work). First styling bug causes mild doubt. Live Preview mismatches (custom input, date) increase frustration. Successful deletion and tab navigation give brief relief. Repeated blockers with logo upload, template selection, and final PDF generation lead to high frustration and loss of trust by the end.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Clear state keeps users oriented; missing styles look broken and hamper trust.
next_actions: Ensure default ‘From & To’ tab ships with explicit active styles (bg + contrast).
Add aria/current attributes for accessibility & easier testing.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Preview is the product’s differentiator; any lag or omission makes users question whether data will be saved/exported.
next_actions: Debounce but guarantee update after each field change (custom inputs, dates).
Add subtle loading indicator if generation takes >300 ms.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Businesses rely on custom fields; if value doesn’t surface in preview, feature is useless.
next_actions: Bind custom field values to preview schema.
Add inline validation + instant preview highlight.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Branding is critical; failed upload or unclear errors create hard blockers.
next_actions: Add drop-zone with progress + error messages (‘file too big’, ‘network error’).
Persist logo to local state so refresh doesn’t lose it.
Provide deterministic selector/ID for test automation & accessibility.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users expect immediate visual confirmation; absent check-mark or unchanged preview causes confusion.
next_actions: After ‘Select’, apply selected style class and scroll preview into view.
Animate preview change to make switch obvious.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Five tabs + actions can feel heavy; users may abandon.
next_actions: Enable ‘Save draft’ so users don’t fear losing work.
Inline tips (e.g., ‘You can skip logo now and add later’).

first_tackles.description: Fix Live Preview bindings for custom inputs and date fields – highest visibility, low code change.
Add/repair ‘active’ styling for navigation tabs so selected state is unmistakable.
Ensure template ‘Select’ button toggles a selected class and triggers preview re-render.
Return clear client-side error messages for logo upload failures; fallback to default placeholder.
Introduce lightweight progress indicator across the 5-step flow to reduce perceived friction.
